intro: Nacibea reclinata, commonly known as the hanging sedge, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and grass-like plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, grass-like stems and small, inconspicuous flowers that typically bloom in clusters. Nacibea reclinata often grows in wet or marshy habitats, thriving in environments with consistent moisture. Its botanical features make it an important species in wetland ecosystems.
